The international train of the Arts Center is arriving at the second stop soon! After Vienna, next stop we head to the United States and enter the â€œSwing Eraâ€. Nominated for a Grammy Award, Antonio Hart, a jazz saxophone player, is going to swing lively with the NDHU Jazz Big Bandat 7 pm on 18th April!

Born in Baltimore, Maryland, Antonio Hart has loved jazz music since he was a child. At the Berklee College of Music in Boston, Hart studied with Bill Pierce, Andy McGhee, and Joe Viola. This let him believe that neither theories nor music can be neglected, and he often practiced alone until late at night. During the process of practice, he realized that it was not enough to immerse himself in only practicing, therefore, he became a â€œMusic Education Majorâ€ when he was senior.

Antonio Hart continued his master degree at Queens College after graduating from Berklee College of Music. There he had the opportunity to learn from Jimmy Heath and Donald Byrd. 12 years later after graduating from Queens College, Antonio Hart returned to his alma mater and became a full-time tenured Professor, and continued to hold various lectures and music activities in the United States, Europe and Asia. Additionally, Hart also practices Wing Chun, and pays attention to any kind of music that inspires him, in order to give the best performance.

Friends who love jazz music, please seize this rare opportunity and meet up with your friends to spend a wonderful night of jazz with Antonio Hart!
